content.description:
Sit start near the left arete on the east face. Use any combination of sharp underclings and the horizontal rail to get off the ground and fire for the lip. 

 The scrunchy nature of the problem may favor shorter climbers.
content.location: About 5 feet to the left of Access Denied.

content.description: Start on the same holds as Access Denied. Move up and right into the horizontal crack system. Follow it all the way around both aretes to the slab side of the boulder, then top out straight up.
content.location: Starts on the east face of Overseer (away from the trail), works around to the west face (towards the trail)

content.description: On the slab face of Overseer, climb up the right  arete. Start with right hand palm pressing the obvious jug at hip height.
content.location: On the west face of Overseer

content.description:
Start with left hand in the vertical crack, and right hand on an undercling about 2 feet to the right of the crack. Climb up and slightly to the left to get to the lip.  

  The topout is quite tricky due to the glassy lip and lack of obvious holds. Look for a shallow dish for the right hand to help get your feet up.
content.location: On the east side of the Overseer, facing away from the trail.

content.description:
A tall, boxy boulder with a few decent problems and good landings. 

  Note: There is no obvious, safe downclimb from this boulder. One method is to sit on the east lip near the Scruncher project, then jump to the nearby smaller boulder.
